docfields.name: KCrash
docfields.text: It allows you to set a crash handler function that will be called when your application crashes and also provides a default crash handler that implements the following functionality Launches the KDE crash display application DrKonqi to let the user report the bug and/or debug it Calls an emergency save function that you can set with setEmergencySaveFunction() to attempt to save the application s data Autorestarts your application All the above features are optional and you need to enable them explicitly By default the defaultCrashHandler() will not do anything However if you are using KApplication it will by default enable launching DrKonqi on crashes unless the nocrashhandler argument was passed on the command line or the environment variable KDE_DEBUG is set to any value

docfields.name: KCrash::HandlerType
docfields.text: The function s argument is the number of the signal

docfields.name: KCrash::KeepFDs
docfields.text: don t close all file descriptors immediately

docfields.name: KCrash::SaferDialog
docfields.text: start DrKonqi without arbitrary disk access

docfields.name: KCrash::AlwaysDirectly
docfields.text: never try to to start DrKonqi via kdeinit Use fork() and exec() instead

docfields.name: KCrash::AutoRestart
docfields.text: autorestart this application Only sensible for KUniqueApplications 4.1

docfields.name: KCrash::defaultCrashHandler
docfields.text: Do not call this function directly Instead use setCrashHandler() to set it as your application s crash handler signal the signal number If you implement your own crash handler you will have to call this function from your implementation if you want to use the features of this namespace

docfields.name: KCrash::initialize
docfields.text: This does nothing if is set Call this in your main() to ensure that the crash handler is always launched 5.15

docfields.name: KCrash::setCrashHandler
docfields.text: A crash occurs when one of the following signals is caught SIGSEGV SIGBUS SIGFPE SIGILL SIGABRT handler this can be one of null in which case signal catching is disabled by setting the signal handler for the crash signals to SIG_DFL a user defined function in the form static if in a class void myCrashHandler(int) if handler is omitted the default crash handler is installed If you use setDrKonqiEnabled(true) setEmergencySaveFunction(myfunc) or setFlags(AutoRestart) you do not need to call this function explicitly The default crash handler is automatically installed by those functions if needed However if you set a custom crash handler those functions will not change it

docfields.name: KCrash::setDrKonqiEnabled
docfields.text: By default launching DrKonqi is enabled when QCoreApplication is created To disable it It is the crash handler s responsibility to launch DrKonqi Therefore if no crash handler is set this method also installs the default crash handler to ensure that DrKonqi will be launched 4.5

docfields.name: KCrash::setEmergencySaveFunction
docfields.text: It is the crash handler s responsibility to call this function Therefore if no crash handler is set the default crash handler is installed to ensure the save function will be called saveFunction the handler to install

docfields.text: KCrash Graceful handling of application crashes Introduction KCrash provides support for intercepting and handling application crashes
